meanings.sent1: The tornado was stroying the small town, leaving nothing but debris.
meanings.sent2: The vandals were stroying the playground equipment, making it unsafe for children to play.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon was stroying the picnic area, looking for food to steal.
meanings.sent4: The wildfire was stroying everything in its path, consuming trees and homes alike.
meanings.sent5: The giant monster in the movie was stroying the city, causing chaos and destruction.

meanings.definition: The act of causing destruction or ruin
meanings.sent1: The stroying of the ancient artifacts was a tragedy for the museum.
meanings.sent2: The stroying of the old building was necessary for the new construction project.
meanings.sent3: The stroying of the cake by the mischievous dog made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The stroying of trust between friends can be difficult to repair.
meanings.sent5: The stroying of the fragile vase was a heartbreaking accident.
